Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObject
      • Player

  • public class Player
extends GameObject
    The "Player" class, a type of GameObject which the player will be able to control by moving it up, down, left, right, or controlling which angle the player is facing. The player will be able to create or "fire" lasers, which is handled in the Game class.
    Version:
    V1.0.0, 10 June, 2014
    Author:
    Erik Trinh

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(int x, int y, java.awt.image.BufferedImage icon)
      A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, and a predetermined width and height.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCentreX()
      Returns the x-coord of the centre of this object.
      int getCentreY()
      Returns the y-coord of the centre of this object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int x,
      int y,
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage icon)
        A constructor for the class, sets the x-coord, y-coord, and a predetermined width and height. Also sets up the Rectangle. Angle is set to 0 (up/forward/north).
        Parameters:
        x - int for the x-coord of the centre of this object.
        y - int for the y-coord of the centre of this object.
        icon - BufferedImage, stores the image used for the mirror.

        Returns the y-coord of the centre of this object.
